text:
The expression in the image is a simplified form of the quadratic equation $ax^2 + bx + c = 0$. Here, $a$ is -1, $b$ is -3, and $c$ is 0. The equation can be written in LaTeX format as:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& a x^2 + b x + c = 0 \\
& a x^2 + (-3) x + 0 = 0 \\
& a x^2 + 3 x - 0 = 0 \\
& a x^2 + 3 x = 0 \\
& a x^2 + 3 x - x(a) = 0 \\
& a x^2 + 3 x - ax = 0 \\
& (a - 3) x^2 = 0 \\
& x^2 = 0 \\
& x = 0
\end{aligned}
$$

This equation represents the solutions to the quadratic equation, which are $x = 0$ and $x = \frac{1}{3}$.
